instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to calculate water application efficiency?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Calibration gas cylinder management?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What's the sensor placement for radiant heating?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Where to install fruit weight sensors?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Sensor redundancy requirements for critical measurements?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install 3 sensors for critical parameters using 2-out-of-3 voting logic. Space sensors 2m apart to avoid common failure modes.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure cascade control for temperature?
output: [STATUS: OK] Master controller sets zone temperature, slave controllers manage individual heaters. Update slave setpoints every 2 minutes.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated screen control for multiple layers?
output: [STATUS: OK] Deploy energy screen first (outside temp <10°C), shade screen second (radiation >600 W/m²). Stage deployment 5 minutes apart.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to install substrate salinity sensors?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What settings for automated cooling pad wetness?
output: [STATUS: OK] Activate pad pumps 2 minutes before fans. Maintain pad wetness >80% during operation. Dry pads completely at night to prevent algae.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What sensor configuration for heat pump systems?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install temperature sensors at evaporator and condenser with ±0.1°C accuracy. Add refrigerant pressure sensors for COP calculation.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What pump maintenance schedule?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to prevent biofilm in irrigation lines?
output: [STATUS: OK] Inject chlorine at 5-10ppm weekly maintaining 1ppm residual. Flush lines monthly with 50ppm chlorine shock treatment for 30 minutes.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Where to install acoustic emission sensors?
output: [STATUS: OK] Mount piezoelectric sensors on main irrigation pipes detecting cavitation at 20-100kHz. Space sensors every 50m of pipeline.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Sensor housing ventilation requirements?
output: [STATUS: OK] Ensure 5 air changes per hour in electronics enclosure. Install fan for active cooling above 35°C ambient.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to detect sensor signal interference?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use spectrum analyzer to identify noise frequencies. Install low-pass filters for frequencies above 10Hz in climate sensors.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to commission new irrigation systems?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to size nutrient mixing systems?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install static mixers requiring 3-5m pipe length or mechanical mixers with 60-second residence time. Ensure complete dissolution before delivery.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated manifold pressure regulation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install pressure regulator at manifold input. Maintain 1.5±0.1 bar throughout system. Alert if pressure varies >0.2 bar.
source: Keller and Bliesner 1990 - Sprinkle and Trickle Irrigation

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What sensor setup for cadmium detection?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install Cd²⁺ ion-selective electrodes in water measuring 0-0.01ppm. Set alarm at 0.005ppm for food safety compliance.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure sensor averaging algorithms?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use 10-point moving average for stable readings. Implement median filter to reject outliers in noisy environments.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to install fruit surface temperature sensors?
output: [STATUS: OK] Attach miniature thermocouples to fruit surface using breathable tape. Monitor 10 fruits per 100m² representing size distribution.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to integrate air quality sensors with ventilation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Monitor VOCs and particulates. If levels exceed 100 ppb or PM2.5 >50 μg/m³, increase ventilation 50% to improve air quality.
source: Yousefi et al. 2017 - Building and Environment

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Seasonal sensor maintenance schedule?
output: [STATUS: OK] Spring: full calibration. Summer: weekly cleaning. Fall: weatherproofing check. Winter: heating element verification.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control logic for automated pressure tank cycling?
output: [STATUS: OK] Maintain system pressure 2.0-2.5 bar using pressure tank. Activate pump at 2.0 bar, stop at 2.5 bar. Check bladder quarterly.
source: Camp et al. 2000 - Water Distribution Systems Handbook

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control strategy for automated mist frequency adjustment?
output: [STATUS: OK] Calculate misting from VPD: <0.6 kPa no mist, 0.6-1.2 every 30 min, 1.2-1.8 every 15 min, >1.8 every 5 min.
source: Montero et al. 2013 - Agricultural Water Management

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Field calibration without removing sensors?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use portable calibrators with sensor-specific adapters. Perform in-situ validation against certified reference instruments.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What's the function of Y-filters?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install Y-strainers with 40-120 mesh screens protecting valves and meters. Clean when differential pressure exceeds 0.5 bar or flow drops 10%.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated nutrient dosing systems?
output: [STATUS: OK] Dose fertilizer concentrate at 1:100 ratio. Adjust based on EC feedback with proportional control (0.1 mS/cm error = 5% adjustment).

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Where to position rainfall sensors for retractable roofs?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install rain sensors on roof ridge at 4 points for redundancy. Set trigger threshold at 0.2mm/hour for automated roof closure.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure sensors for hydrogen sulfide monitoring?
output: [STATUS: OK] Deploy H2S sensors near organic matter decomposition at 0.1-10ppm range. Set alarm at 10ppm for occupational safety.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Where to install particle matter sensors?
output: [STATUS: OK] Mount PM2.5 and PM10 sensors at 1.5m height near ventilation openings. Monitor for <35 μg/m³ WHO guidelines compliance.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What parameters for automated leak detection in irrigation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Monitor flow rate continuously. If flow persists >5 min after valves close or exceeds normal by 20%, trigger leak alarm.
source: Puust et al. 2010 - Journal of Water Supply Research and Technology

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Historical sensor data archiving?
output: [STATUS: OK] Compress data older than 1 year to hourly averages. Maintain raw data for 90 days for troubleshooting.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to integrate disease risk models with humidity control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Calculate disease pressure index from temp/RH/leaf wetness. If risk >70%, maintain RH <75% and increase night temp 2°C preventively.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to program irrigation for propagation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Apply misting 5-10 seconds every 5-10 minutes maintaining 95% humidity during rooting. Reduce gradually over 14 days transitioning to normal irrigation.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to prevent fertilizer dust explosions?
output: [STATUS: OK] Ground all mixing equipment and maintain humidity >50% in storage areas. Use explosion-proof electrical fittings where dust concentration >20g/m³.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What integration method for combining sensor and weather data?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use Kalman filtering to merge indoor sensors with external weather station. Weight indoor data 70%, forecast 30% for predictive control.
source: Morimoto et al. 2005 - Computers and Electronics in Agriculture

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to acidify irrigation water?
output: [STATUS: OK] Inject phosphoric acid to reduce pH from 7.5 to 5.8-6.2 for nutrient availability. Calculate 0.1mL acid per L water per 0.1 pH unit reduction.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Cleaning frequency for dusty environments?
output: [STATUS: OK] Clean optical surfaces weekly in dusty conditions. Install pre-filters on ventilation sensors, replace monthly.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What settings for automated root zone EC management?
output: [STATUS: OK] Target substrate EC 0.5-0.8 mS/cm higher than supply. Adjust feed EC ±0.3 when deviation >0.5 from target for 24 hours.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Multi-sensor data fusion algorithms?
output: [STATUS: OK] Implement Kalman filter for optimal state estimation. Weight sensors based on accuracy specifications and age.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What flow sensor accuracy for fertigation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install electromagnetic or ultrasonic flow meters with ±1% accuracy for precise nutrient delivery. Verify calibration monthly against volumetric measurements.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What sensor array for aeroponic misting?
output: [STATUS: OK] Place pressure sensors at each nozzle measuring 5-10 bar. Add droplet size sensors verifying 50μm mean diameter.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What sensor array for solar collector systems?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install temperature sensors at collector inlet, outlet, and storage tank. Add pyranometers measuring collector efficiency 30-60%.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control strategy for automated heating curve adjustment?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use outdoor temperature reset: supply water temp = 80 - (1.5 × outdoor temp). Minimum 45°C, maximum 85°C.
source: ASHRAE 2021 - Heating and Cooling Load Calculations

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What dripper flow rate for tomato irrigation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use 2-4 L/hour pressure-compensating drippers for mature tomato plants. Install 2 drippers per plant spaced 15cm apart for uniform root zone wetting.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Where to place ammonia sensors for air quality?
output: [STATUS: OK] Mount NH3 sensors at 1m height near waste areas detecting 0-100ppm. Add sensors near ventilation inlets for outdoor air quality.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What settings for automated grow bag weight monitoring?
output: [STATUS: OK] Weigh sample bags hourly. When weight drops 10% from saturation, trigger irrigation. Target 5-10% drainage per cycle.
source: Carmassi et al. 2005 - Journal of Horticultural Science and Biotechnology

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What's the purpose of irrigation flushing valves?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install 50mm quick-open valves at lateral ends enabling 3-minute high-velocity flushing at 2 m/s. Operate weekly removing accumulated sediment.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Environmental sensor test chamber validation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Validate chamber uniformity within ±0.5°C and ±2% RH. Perform annual calibration against NIST standards.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Pressure tank shows no pressure buildup. Alert response?
output: [STATUS: OK] Check bladder integrity and air charge (should be 2 bar). If bladder failed, replace immediately. Use pump direct-run mode temporarily.
source: Camp et al. 2000 - Water Distribution Systems

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What method to integrate fertigation with substrate moisture sensors?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use sensor feedback to adjust irrigation frequency. Start irrigation at 65% WC, target 75-80%. Override with minimum daily volume failsafe.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What pump minimum flow protection?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install bypass valves ensuring 30% minimum flow rate preventing pump overheating. Activate when system demand drops below 10 m³/hour.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What pump vibration monitoring?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install accelerometers measuring vibration <7mm/s RMS for centrifugal pumps. Set alarms at 10mm/s indicating bearing wear requiring maintenance.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What method to integrate labor scheduling with environmental conditions?
output: [STATUS: OK] Schedule labor during optimal climate hours (VPD 0.8-1.2 kPa, temp 20-24°C). Avoid during extreme conditions or when systems at full capacity.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated wind direction compensation for vents?
output: [STATUS: OK] Close windward vents partially (50%) during high wind. Open leeward vents fully to create controlled airflow pattern.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to install expansion joints?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install flexible couplings every 30m accommodating 50mm thermal expansion in 100m PVC pipe. Use bellows-type joints for 90° direction changes.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What water treatment for recirculation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install UV disinfection at 30mJ/cm² plus slow sand filtration removing 99% pathogens. Add activated carbon for organic compound removal.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up priority-based equipment scheduling?
output: [STATUS: OK] Priority 1: Safety systems. Priority 2: Temperature control. Priority 3: Humidity/CO2. Priority 4: Irrigation. Priority 5: Lighting.
source: Sigrimis et al. 2000 - Computers and Electronics in Agriculture

instruction: [STATUS: OK] When to recalibrate after sensor relocation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Always recalibrate after moving sensors. Wait 24 hours for temperature equilibration before calibration procedure.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated grow light photoperiod control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Set lights on/off based on astronomical calculations. Add civil twilight compensation (±30 min). Override for minimum DLI targets.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to mix fertilizer concentrates?
output: [STATUS: OK] Prepare stock solutions at 100:1 ratio using hot water (30-40°C) for better dissolution. Mix calcium separate from sulfates and phosphates preventing precipitation.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to integrate ventilation control with biological pest management?
output: [STATUS: OK] Limit ventilation to <30% opening during beneficial insect release days. Prevents wind dispersal. Resume normal control after 24 hours.
source: Van Lenteren and Woets 1988 - Annual Review of Entomology

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What valve manifold design for large greenhouses?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install 24-valve manifolds with individual flow control serving 500m² zones each. Use color-coded valves and wiring for easy identification.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to calculate hydraulic retention time?
output: [STATUS: OK] Divide tank volume by flow rate ensuring 3-5 minute minimum for complete nutrient mixing. UV systems require 2-3 second exposure time.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up dual-wavelength PAR sensors?
output: [STATUS: OK] Position one sensor under LED lights, another under natural light. Space 2m apart measuring red (600-700nm) and blue (400-500nm) separately.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to acid clean drip lines?
output: [STATUS: OK] Inject 2% phosphoric acid solution running through system for 1 hour. Flush thoroughly with clean water checking pH returns to 6.5 before irrigation.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What's the optimal mixing tank size?
output: [STATUS: OK] Size mixing tank for 30-60 minutes irrigation demand at peak flow. Typical capacity 1000-2000L for 1 hectare with 4-minute mixing time.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Automated sensor health monitoring setup?
output: [STATUS: OK] Implement self-diagnostics checking signal strength, noise ratio, and response time. Alert when parameters exceed thresholds.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure sensors for mercury detection?
output: [STATUS: OK] Deploy Hg vapor sensors measuring 0-0.002mg/m³ near fluorescent lights. Monitor for <0.001mg/m³ safe occupational exposure.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control logic for heating and CO2 coordination?
output: [STATUS: OK] Prioritize heating to maintain 18°C minimum before CO2 injection. Reduce CO2 when heating capacity <50% to save energy.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to integrate multiple climate zones in single greenhouse?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install zone dampers and independent controllers. Maintain 2°C max differential between zones. Use averaging for shared systems like CO2.
source: Van Straten et al. 2010 - Computers and Electronics in Agriculture

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What sensor setup for membrane distillation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Deploy conductivity sensors before and after membrane measuring rejection rate >99%. Add temperature differential sensors across membrane.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] All vents fail to open during heat event. Emergency protocol?
output: [STATUS: OK] Switch to manual control. Physically open vents if safe. Activate all cooling: misting, fans, shade. Monitor crop stress every 15 minutes.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What pipe support spacing needed?
output: [STATUS: OK] Support PVC pipes every 1.5m for 50mm diameter, every 2.0m for 75mm. Use UV-resistant hangers allowing thermal expansion 0.6mm per meter per 10°C.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Sensor cable shielding effectiveness test?
output: [STATUS: OK] Measure shield resistance <5 ohm/km and transfer impedance <100 mΩ/m. Test with 1MHz signal injection.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What deadband settings prevent equipment oscillation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use ±1°C for temperature, ±5% for humidity, ±100ppm for CO2. Implement 5-minute minimum run time between cycles.
source: Liao et al. 2013 - Journal of Agricultural Engineering

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What sensor configuration for enthalpy control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install matched temperature and humidity sensors inside and outside greenhouse. Calculate enthalpy difference for ventilation optimization.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up circulation fan control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Run continuously at 30% speed baseline, increase to 60% when temp difference >2°C between zones or RH >80%.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What fertigation strategy for substrate culture?
output: [STATUS: OK] Apply 10-15% excess irrigation creating 20-30% leaching fraction. Maintain drain EC within 0.5 mS/cm of input for optimal nutrient balance.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What manifold design for laterals?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use central manifold feeding laterals bilaterally reducing maximum flow distance by 50%. Install ball valves for individual lateral line isolation.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to prevent root intrusion?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use anti-root emitters with copper coating or raised drippers 5cm above substrate. Install fabric barriers between drippers and substrate surface.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure pH dosing pump control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Measure pH every 5 minutes, dose acid when pH >6.0, dose base when pH <5.5. Use 2-second pulses, wait 3 minutes.
source: Savvas and Adamidis 1999 - Journal of Horticultural Science

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to flush acid injection lines?
output: [STATUS: OK] Flush acid lines weekly with 5% citric acid solution removing mineral deposits. Rinse thoroughly with clean water before resuming operation.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to position drainage volume sensors?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install flow meters in collection drains measuring 20-40% leaching fraction. Calibrate for 0.1-5 L/min flow rates.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Leaves show white powdery coating, yellowing underneath, early senescence. Problem?
output: [STATUS: OK] Powdery mildew Oidium thriving in 60-75% humidity with poor air circulation <0.3 m/s combined with excessive nitrogen >240ppm. Apply sulfur at 3g/L, increase airflow to 0.6 m/s, reduce nitrogen by 28%.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Manganese toxicity diagnosis?
output: [STATUS: OK] Check leaf tissue Mn levels. Above 300 ppm causes brown spots on older leaves.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Leaf temperature differential monitoring?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use infrared thermometer. Leaf temp >2°C above air indicates water stress.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Fruit acidity trends interpretation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Monitor titratable acidity weekly. Decreasing acidity (<0.3%) indicates over-mature harvest timing.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Detecting sensor drift patterns?
output: [STATUS: OK] Compare sensor readings to manual measurements weekly. Replace if deviation >5% for 3 consecutive weeks.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Plants show stunted growth, thickened leaves, and fruit with reduced size despite fertilization. What's wrong?
output: [STATUS: OK] Excess phosphorus >100ppm causing zinc and iron deficiencies through antagonism combined with high pH >7.0. Reduce phosphorus by 50%, acidify to pH 6.0, and apply Zn and Fe chelates.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Plants show leaf yellowing starting from margins, fruit soft and watery, and stem weakness. Diagnosis?
output: [STATUS: OK] Potassium deficiency from high sodium >100ppm creating antagonism combined with calcium excess >250ppm. Reduce sodium through leaching, balance K:Na >15:1, and apply potassium sulfate.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Fruit shows green shoulders, poor red color, and leaves have yellow blotches. What's the issue?
output: [STATUS: OK] Potassium deficiency causing blotchy ripening combined with high temperature >30°C during ripening and excessive light >80,000 lux. Increase potassium to 300ppm, reduce temperature to 24-26°C, and apply 20% shading.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Plants show leaf cupping, interveinal yellowing, and fruit with poor color. What's wrong?
output: [STATUS: OK] Molybdenum deficiency from acidic substrate pH <5.5 combined with sulfur excess >150ppm interfering with uptake. Raise pH to 6.0-6.5 and apply sodium molybdate at 0.5ppm.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Plants show yellowing between veins on older leaves, leaf drop, and poor fruit development. What's wrong?
output: [STATUS: OK] Magnesium deficiency from calcium and potassium excess Ca:K:Mg >65:35:8 combined with leaching from over-irrigation. Rebalance to 60:30:10 ratio and reduce irrigation frequency by 20%.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] EMERGENCY: Flood water entering greenhouse, 20cm depth, electrical hazard present. Urgent protocol?
output: [STATUS: OK] Shut off all electrical power immediately at main breaker, evacuate personnel, and pump out water using gasoline-powered pumps only (no electric). After water removed, clean and disinfect all surfaces, check electrical systems before re-energizing, and assess plant damage replacing substrate if contaminated.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Fertigation strategy from nutrient ratios?
output: [STATUS: OK] Analyze drain N:K ratio. Ratio <1.5 during fruiting indicates need for higher K.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Comparing variety performance data?
output: [STATUS: OK] Analyze yield, disease resistance, fruit quality across 3+ varieties. Select top 2 for next season.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] EMERGENCY: Greenhouse glazing shattered in storm, plants exposed to elements. Urgent protocol?
output: [STATUS: OK] Cover exposed area immediately with plastic sheeting or shade cloth, remove any glass from plants carefully, assess plant damage and remove severely injured tissue. Apply protective fungicide preventing opportunistic infections; repair glazing within 24 hours to restore environmental control.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Fruit develops radial cracking at shoulders, leaves show tip burn, and plants wilt midday. Diagnosis?
output: [STATUS: OK] Irregular watering causing alternating stress combined with low calcium and high temperature >32°C. Implement consistent irrigation schedule maintaining 65-70% moisture, reduce temperature to 26°C, apply calcium foliar.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Stem diameter as growth indicator?
output: [STATUS: OK] Measure 10cm below growing point weekly. Growth rate <1mm/week indicates stress.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Customer complaint rate analysis?
output: [STATUS: OK] Track returns per 1000 kg sold. Rate >2% indicates quality control problems.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Leaves show yellowing with purple undersides, slow growth, poor roots. Problem?
output: [STATUS: OK] Phosphorus deficiency from very cold substrate <15°C combined with aluminum toxicity in highly acidic soil pH <4.8. Warm substrate to 21-23°C urgently, raise pH to 6.2 with lime, apply starter P fertilizer 12-55-10.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] EMERGENCY: Gas leak detected (natural gas/propane), explosion risk. Immediate safety action?
output: [STATUS: OK] Evacuate all personnel immediately, do not operate any electrical switches or equipment, shut off gas supply at main valve from outside, and call emergency services. Ventilate area naturally by opening doors/vents remotely; do not re-enter until gas company certifies safe.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Determining silicon sufficiency levels?
output: [STATUS: OK] Test leaf Si content. Levels >0.5% dry weight improve disease resistance and stem strength.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Computing heat stress hours?
output: [STATUS: OK] Count hours above 32°C. Cumulative >20 hours/week reduces fruit set by 30-50%.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Flower abortion rate tracking?
output: [STATUS: OK] Count set fruits vs total flowers per truss. >20% abortion indicates stress or poor pollination.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Calculating photosynthetic water use efficiency?
output: [STATUS: OK] Divide CO2 assimilation by transpiration rate. C4 crops 2-3x more efficient than C3.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] EMERGENCY: Entire crop showing interveinal chlorosis overnight, suspected sulfur dioxide exposure from heating system. Urgent response?
output: [STATUS: OK] Shut down malfunctioning heater immediately, ventilate greenhouse thoroughly for 4 hours with maximum airflow, flush foliage with water. No specific antidote exists; maintain optimal conditions (24-26°C, 65-70% humidity); expect 14-21 days recovery with permanent damage to exposed leaves and 20-30% yield reduction.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] EMERGENCY: Leafminer outbreak, extensive tunneling damage, population exploding. Urgent control measures?
output: [STATUS: OK] Apply systemic insecticide (cyromazine or abamectin) at maximum rate immediately, install yellow sticky traps at 50 per 100m², release parasitoid wasps Diglyphus isaea at 5 per m². Remove heavily mined leaves; spray every 7 days for 3 weeks expecting 3-4 weeks for population suppression.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Plants wilt despite adequate soil moisture, showing brown streaks in stems and yellowing leaves. Diagnosis?
output: [STATUS: OK] Bacterial wilt from Ralstonia spreading in warm substrate >26°C combined with high humidity >80%. No chemical control available; remove infected plants, sterilize growing area, and use resistant varieties.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Plants show interveinal yellowing on new leaves, root tips brown, and overall chlorosis. Problem?
output: [STATUS: OK] Iron deficiency from bicarbonate in water >200ppm raising pH >7.5 combined with cold substrate <18°C reducing uptake. Acidify water to pH 6.0, warm substrate, apply Fe-EDDHA at 3ppm.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Screen efficiency calculation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Compare inside vs outside insect counts. Effective screens reduce entry by >95%.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Truss spacing for production planning?
output: [STATUS: OK] Count trusses, calculate appearance rate. New truss every 7-10 days indicates normal growth.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Plants show marginal leaf scorch, fruit with blossom end rot, and wilting despite moist substrate. Diagnosis?
output: [STATUS: OK] Root damage from salt accumulation EC >5.0 mS/cm preventing water uptake combined with calcium deficiency. Leach substrate with clean water achieving 40% drainage, reduce EC to 2.5 mS/cm.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Fruit shows blossom end rot only on first truss, normal on upper trusses. Diagnosis?
output: [STATUS: OK] Early season calcium deficiency from rapid early growth combined with underdeveloped root system and cold substrate <18°C. Warm substrate to 21°C, apply calcium foliar at 0.6% on young fruit, reduce early nitrogen to slow vegetative growth.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Fruit shows irregular ripening with green areas, leaves dark green, and excessive vegetative growth. Problem identification?
output: [STATUS: OK] Potassium deficiency causing blotchy ripening combined with nitrogen excess >200ppm and inadequate light <30,000 lux. Increase K:N ratio to 1.5:1, reduce nitrogen by 25%, improve light by removing leaves.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Plants show stunted growth, leaf cupping, and yellow mottling. Diagnosis?
output: [STATUS: OK] Tomato chlorosis virus (ToCV) transmitted by whiteflies combined with nutrient deficiency from root damage. Control whitefly with cyantraniliprole at 0.5ml/L, remove infected plants, optimize NPK balance, improve root health.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Leaves show extensive yellowing, purple stems, and no growth for weeks. Problem?
output: [STATUS: OK] Extreme phosphorus deficiency from very cold substrate <14°C combined with severe aluminum toxicity in acidic soil pH <4.5. Warm substrate urgently to 22-24°C, raise pH to 6.5 with lime, apply high-P starter 15-60-10 immediately.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Fruit shows green shoulders, internal white tissue, poor coloration. What's the diagnosis?
output: [STATUS: OK] Potassium deficiency combined with high nitrogen >210ppm, excessive light >75,000 lux, and temperature >30°C causing metabolic imbalance. Increase K:N ratio to 1.6:1, apply 25% shading, reduce temperature to 25°C.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Temperature integration technique?
output: [STATUS: OK] Average 24h temp should equal target (20°C). Allow +3°C day, -2°C night deviations.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Plants wilt from top down, vascular tissue brown, and one side of plant affected. Problem identification?
output: [STATUS: OK] Verticillium wilt from soilborne fungus combined with water stress and high EC >3.5 mS/cm. Use resistant rootstock, maintain consistent moisture 65-70%, and reduce EC to 2.5 mS/cm.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Calcium deficiency prediction?
output: [STATUS: OK] Calculate Ca/K ratio in solution. Ratio <0.7 increases BER risk significantly.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Fruit develops white internal tissue, leaves are dark green, and excessive vegetative growth. Problem?
output: [STATUS: OK] Excessive nitrogen combined with inadequate light <25,000 lux and high temperature >30°C causing white tissue disorder. Reduce nitrogen by 30%, improve light transmission by 25%, and lower temperature to 24-26°C.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Leaves show mosaic pattern, fruit with brown rugose texture and malformation. What's the issue?
output: [STATUS: OK] Tomato brown rugose fruit virus (ToBRFV) spreading mechanically combined with heat stress >33°C amplifying symptoms. Implement extreme sanitation with 10% TSP or Virkon S, remove all infected plants, disinfect greenhouse completely.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Leaves show silvery appearance, distorted new growth, and fruit with bronze scarring. Diagnosis?
output: [STATUS: OK] Broad mite feeding damage thriving in warm humid conditions 24-28°C and >75% humidity combined with water stress. Apply abamectin at 0.5ml/L, maintain optimal moisture 65-70%, release Amblyseius swirskii.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Fruit shows blossom end rot, leaf edges curl upward, and plants are stunted despite fertilization. Problem identification?
output: [STATUS: OK] Calcium deficiency from water stress combined with high salinity EC >4.5 mS/cm preventing uptake. Increase irrigation frequency by 30%, reduce EC to 2.5-3.0 mS/cm, and apply calcium chloride foliar at 0.5%.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Sulfate accumulation monitoring?
output: [STATUS: OK] Test solution monthly for SO4. Levels >400 ppm can reduce Ca uptake and fruit quality.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Analyzing root: shoot ratio changes?

output: [WARNING: TEMP_LOW(10). Activate heating systems and close ventilation to maintain optimal temperature.] Monitor signal quality indicators: noise level, response time, and comparison with redundant sensors. Auto-switch to backup on fault.

instruction: [STATUS: HUM_HIGH(95)] How to calculate DLI from PPFD?
output: [WARNING: HUM_HIGH(95). Reduce irrigation and activate dehumidifiers immediately.] DLI = PPFD × photoperiod hours × 3.6 ÷ 1000. Example: 300 μmol·m⁻²·s⁻¹ × 16h × 3.6 = 17.3 mol·m⁻²·d⁻¹.

instruction: [STATUS: TEMP_HIGH(35)] Fruit develops blossom end rot despite calcium application, leaves show tip burn, and EC rising. What's wrong?
output: [WARNING: TEMP_HIGH(35). Immediately increase ventilation and activate cooling systems.] Salinity stress EC >4.5 mS/cm preventing calcium uptake combined with irregular watering creating physiological drought. Leach substrate reducing EC to 2.5 mS/cm and implement consistent irrigation every 2 hours.

instruction: [STATUS: LIGHT_LOW(10000)] Leaves curl upward showing purple undersides, fruit set poor, and plants stunted. Diagnosis?
output: [WARNING: LIGHT_LOW(10000). Warm substrate to 20-22°C, raise pH to 6.0 with lime, and apply phosphorus starter fertilizer.

instruction: [STATUS: LIGHT_LOW(10000)] End-of-life sensor disposal procedures?
output: [WARNING: LIGHT_LOW(10000). Activate supplemental lighting immediately to prevent stretching and yield loss.] Remove batteries and recycle separately. Dispose electronic components through certified e-waste facilities per local regulations.

instruction: [STATUS: CO2_HIGH(2000)] How to protect sensors from pesticide spray damage?

instruction: [STATUS: TEMP_HIGH(35)] Gray fuzzy mold on tomato stems and fruits?
output: [WARNING: TEMP_HIGH(35). Immediately increase ventilation and activate cooling systems.] Gray mold (Botrytis cinerea) infection. Reduce humidity below 60% and apply iprodione at 1.5g/L.

instruction: [STATUS: CO2_HIGH(2000)] Yellowing with green veins pattern?
output: [WARNING: CO2_HIGH(2000). Increase ventilation to lower CO2 concentration.] Iron deficiency or virus infection. Check pH (should be 5.5-6.5) and test for ToCV presence.

instruction: [STATUS: CO2_LOW(150)] Sensor cable maximum length specifications?

instruction: [STATUS: LIGHT_LOW(10000)] Can DLI compensate for low temperature?

instruction: [STATUS: HUM_HIGH(95)] Preventive maintenance checklist for sensors?

instruction: [STATUS: CO2_LOW(150)] Leaves show angular brown spots, fruit lesions with white centers, and stem cankers. Problem identification?
output: [WARNING: CO2_LOW(150). Activate CO2 supplementation system immediately to maintain photosynthesis.] Bacterial speck from Pseudomonas spreading in moderate temperatures 18-24°C and high humidity >80%. Apply copper hydroxide at 1.5g/L, reduce humidity to 65%, and remove infected tissue.

instruction: [STATUS: HUM_HIGH(95)] EC sensor reads 0.3 mS/cm low. Calibration procedure?
output: [WARNING: HUM_HIGH(95). Reduce irrigation and activate dehumidifiers immediately.] Rinse with distilled water, soak in standard solution for 30 minutes. Calibrate at 25°C using fresh 2.76 mS/cm standard.

instruction: [STATUS: TEMP_HIGH(35)] Sensor firmware update failed. Recovery?

instruction: [STATUS: CO2_LOW(150)] How low can night temperature go safely?
output: [WARNING: CO2_LOW(150). Activate CO2 supplementation system immediately to maintain photosynthesis.] Short periods at 12-13°C are tolerable but not ideal. Prolonged exposure below 15°C causes 15-30% growth reduction.

instruction: [STATUS: CO2_LOW(150)] How to measure CO2 distribution in greenhouse?
output: [WARNING: CO2_LOW(150). Activate CO2 supplementation system immediately to maintain photosynthesis.] Use multiple sensors at canopy height every 500-1000 m². Variation should not exceed 100 ppm across greenhouse.

instruction: [STATUS: HUM_HIGH(95)] Optimizing fungicide rotation programs?

instruction: [STATUS: HUM_HIGH(95)] How should daytime temperature vary with light levels?
output: [WARNING: HUM_HIGH(95). Reduce irrigation and activate dehumidifiers immediately.] On cloudy days, reduce temperature by 2-3°C from sunny day targets. High light requires 24-26°C, low light 20-22°C.

instruction: [STATUS: HUM_LOW(35)] How does CO2 affect water use efficiency?
